docs.lead_paragraph: THE CLAIM -- Breakfast is the most important meal of the day. THE FACTS -- For many Americans, it might be the last thing they heard from their parents while bolting out the door for school each morning. But the notion that eating breakfast is a must, studies show, is not simply a tired adage. Experts say a proper meal each morning can help ward off disease.
docs.abstract: Studies show that individuals who eat breakfast are often healthier than people who skip breakfast; drawing (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Tammy Quist, principal of Fairview High School in Boulder, was not surprised when she learned in April that a student was in a coma after overdosing on an over-the-counter cold medicine. ''It's out there, and you know kids do it,'' Ms. Quist said. ''It's cheap, accessible and it's not illegal if kids get caught. And it usually goes unnoticed until a kid takes too much or combines it with something to get a horrible reaction and overdoses.''

headline.main: Now at Your Drugstore: A Cheap and Dangerous High

docs.abstract: Cough medicines containing dextromethorphan, DXM, have become popular cheap high among teenagers and young adults; DXM is ingredient in more than 125 nonprescription cough and cold medicines and reduces brain sensitivity to body's cough reflex; incidents of DXM abuse have doubled in past four years; Internet sites carry information on how to get high on cough medicine and many overdose cases are caused by mixing of DXM with other drugs; legislation has been proposed in some states to try and limit availability of drug; Tammy Quist, Fairview High School principal in Boulder, Colorado, suggests parents educate themselves about misuse of DXM and control its storage in home; photo (M)
docs.snippet: Tammy Quist, principal of Fairview High School in Boulder, was not surprised when she learned in April that a student was in a coma after overdosing on an over-the-counter cold medicine.    ''It's out there, and you know kids do it,'' Ms. Quist said....
